intro: Aphyteia multiceps, commonly known as the multiforked fern, is a rare and delicate plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that resemble those of other ferns. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil to flourish. Its reproductive structures, known as sporangia, are clustered in small, round formations along the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, Aphyteia multiceps is considered a vulnerable species in its natural habitat.
